thread.title: NO JOKE! Food Network Star Accused of Racism for the Most Asinine Reason Ever…
thread.title_full: NO JOKE! Food Network Star Accused of Racism for the Most Asinine Reason Ever…

author: Andrew Mark Miller
title: NO JOKE! Food Network Star Accused of Racism for the Most Asinine Reason Ever…

organizations.name: food network star accused of racism

text:
Liberals are now claiming the prank is racist.   
From BizPac Review : 
Eater.com described what it found to be the most racist aspect of the prank. 
Earlier in the episode, the Food Network Star explains that her husband loves classic Buffalo wings and she wants to pull a prank on him by serving an Asian iteration. “I like to mess with my spouse, I can’t help it,” she says. The offensive conceit ― that he and his college buddies would be revolted by Asian wings ― was clearly written into the show before it was even filmed. 
Here are some great responses from Twitter.   @dumplingskin @Eater @FoodNetwork @thepioneerwoman not anywhere even close to racist… Simple bit of fun not at all anti-asian   
— Josh Bunch (@TheMrBunch) March 8, 2017  3'); }); @Eater Could it be because they are anything but buffalo? And why does a food site have to have an SJW agenda? I cannot escape this crap. 
— Tim Kuiper (@timpac) March 8, 2017 @timpac @Eater Racist? No. It was buffalo wing swap-out joke. Buffalo wings were expected, swap could've been any other dish. 
— Faith is 24 x 7 (@FaithIs24x7) March 9, 2017 @Eater People love to be offended… 
— Shinzo Abe Froman (@RockRollGhost) March 8, 2017 
Exactly. 
This is why we can’t have nice things. 
You have to have a lot of free time on your hands to complain about something this ridiculous. 
Also, it’s a slap in the face to victims of actual racism.  4'); });
